entries.meaning: (general) A collection of (usually) organized information in a regular structure, usually but not necessarily in a machine-readable format accessible by a computer.
examples: I have a database of all my contacts in my personal organizer.

entries.meaning: (computing) A set of tables and other objects (queries, reports, forms) in the form of a structured data set.
examples: The "books" database will have three tables, and the "customers" database will have two tables.

entries.meaning: (computing, loosely, metonymically) A software program (application) for storing, retrieving and manipulating such a structured data set.
examples: Which database do you use: MySQL or Oracle?

entries.meaning: (computing, loosely, metonymically) A combination of such data sets and the programs for using them.

verbs.description: database (third-person singular simple present databases, present participle databasing, simple past and past participle databased)

entries.meaning: To enter data into a database.
